pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:0.5: 46. The training rule on stuffing the cheeks
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate stuffing their cheeks. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.3.1: “‘I will not eat stuffing my cheeks,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.4: One should not eat stuffing one’s cheeks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats stuffing one or both cheeks, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.11: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk46:1.15: The sixth training rule is finished.
